column3: ## Journal Form Test
Go to admin journal search page at /admin/journals
From the facet "In DOAJ?" on the left choose True
Click "Edit this journal" link at the bottom of any journal - note the id of the edited journal for future reference

column4: Page /admin/journal/<id> is open in a new browser window/tab (<id> is id of the chosen journal)
All the field are initially filled in with correct values

column3: Click red "Withdraw" button at the top of the functions panel on the right

column4: Message pop-up appears over the page asking you to confirm if you want to withdraw the journal and shows you the journal's ID.

column3: Click Close

column4: The box closes and nothing else has changed.

column3: Click Withdraw again and click Withdraw in the pop-up

column4: You see a flash message at the top which says Job to withdraw/reinstate journal has been submitted

column3: Click link to the background jobs interface in the banner

column4: The set_in_doaj background job is created

column3: Click "More Information"

column4: set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct journal id and set_in_doaj__in_doaj -- false parameter is set

column3: Close the background jobs window
Click "Unlock and Close" button at the top of the application

column4:
You see the message: This record is now unlocked
You may close this tab safely.

column3: Go back to the admin search page
From the facet "In DOAJ?" on the left choose False
Click "Edit this journal" link at the bottom of any journal - note the id of the edited journal for future reference

column4: Page /admin/journal/<id> is open in a new browser window/tab (<id> is id of the chosen journal)

column3: Click "Reinstate" button at the top of the functions panel on the right

column4: Message banner appears at the top of the page with the confirmation

column3: Click link to the background jobs interface in the banner

column4: The set_in_doaj background job is created

column3: Click "More Information"

column4: set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct journal id and set_in_doaj__in_doaj -- true parameter is set

column3: Close the background jobs window
Close the journal form and go back to the admin search page
Click "Edit this journal" link at the bottom of any journal - note the title of the edited journal for future reference
Open Editorial Area -> Editor Group dropdown and start writing the name of the Editor Group

column4: After initial 3 characters the list of matching Editor Group names are displayed

column3: Choose any Editor Group name
Repeat steps for "Assigned to" drop-down
Click red "Save" button below

column4: Message banner  "Journal updated" is displayed and additional ones with information about emails sent

column3: Go to Notes section at the very bottom of the functions panel on the right
Click "Notes" red button
Put any text in the note text area
Click red "Save" button

column4: Banner appears at the top of the page "Journal updated"

column3: Click 'Dismiss' at the right end of the banner

column4: In the "Notes" section next to your added note the date field is filled in with correct date and time
